snippet: The magazine acknowledged “discrepancies” in an article that described a gang rape at a University of Virginia fraternity.
abstract: Rolling Stone magazine admits there are discrepancies in article on premeditated gang rape during fraternity party at University of Virginia; Phi Kappa Psi, fraternity in question, disputes several elements of story, including party held during night of alleged rape; advocates for women's safety say questions about article should not undermine university’s heightened attention to sexual assault issues that have festered for years.

byline.original: By RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA and RAVI SOMAIYA
byline.contributor: Richard Pérez-Peña reported from Charlottesville, and Ravi Somaiya from New York. Alan Schwarz contributed reporting from Charlottesville, and Jennifer Steinhauer from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The magazine acknowledged “discrepancies” in an article that described a gang rape at a University of Virginia fraternity.

headline.main: Rolling Stone Cites Doubts on Its Story of University of Virginia Rape
headline.print_headline: Report of Rape at a Fraternity Begins to Fray
